required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reducing Disparities in Diabetes Risk Through Lifestyle Changes in Community Settings
clinical_study.official_title: Physical Activity and Diet to to Reduce Disparities in Diabetes Risk

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to design and test the effectiveness of a lifestyle diabetes risk reduction program, Live Well, Be Well, in reducing risk of diabetes in persons at risk with a focus on reaching lower-income, minority individuals.

detailed_description.textblock: To design and test the effectiveness of a lifestyle diabetes risk reduction program, Live Well, Be Well, to increase physical activity, decrease weight, and improve diet, offered in community-based settings to primarily lower income, minority persons aged 25 and older at moderate to high risk of diabetes. The design is a randomized controlled trial with the primary outcome being fasting plasma glucose; secondary outcomes are weight, physical activity, blood pressure, and other physiological risk factors as well as health-related quality of life. This project is a partnership between the University of California San Francisco and the City of Berkeley Division of Public Health.

arm_group.description: Receives the lifestyle program as soon as possible after randomization
Wait one year and at the end of the year, is offered the option of participating in the program

intervention.description: Lifestyle change program using personal contact and telephone counseling

results_reference.citation: Delgadillo AT, Grossman M, Santoyo-Olsson J, Gallegos-Jackson E, Kanaya AM, Stewart AL. Description of an academic community partnership lifestyle program for lower income minority adults at risk for diabetes. Diabetes Educ. 2010 Jul-Aug;36(4):640-50. doi: 10.1177/0145721710374368. Epub 2010 Jun 24.

Santoyo-Olsson J, Cabrera J, Freyre R, Grossman M, Alvarez N, Mathur D, Guerrero M, Delgadillo AT, Kanaya AM, Stewart AL. An innovative multiphased strategy to recruit underserved adults into a randomized trial of a community-based diabetes risk reduction program. Gerontologist. 2011 Jun;51 Suppl 1:S82-93. doi: 10.1093/geront/gnr026.
